com.ep.customer

Interface Customer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCustomer, LargeCustomer, MediumCustomer, SmallCustomer

    public interface Customer
    The Customer interface provides a set of methods for accessing or modifying Customer data. A Customer can be created by using the CustomerFactory class.
    Author:
    EP

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCredit(double credit)
      Add credit to the Customer, which is not defined as being any particular currency in this interface.
      double getAveragePurchaseAmount()
      Get the statistical average monetary amount for all Product purchases made by this customer.
      double getBalance()
      Get the Customer balance.
      long getID()
      Get the Customer unique ID.
      java.lang.String getMetrics()
      Get a newline separated String that shows all the primary values for the fields associated for a Customer.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Get the Customer Name, which may or may not be unique to every Customer.
      java.util.List<Product> getPurchasedList()
      Get a reference to the List of Products that were purchased by this Customer.
      int getPurchasedQuantity()
      Get the number of Products that were purchased by a Customer.
      double getTotalPurchasesAmount()
      Get the accumulative amount for all the Products purchased by a Customer.
      void makePurchase(Product product)
      Use this method on a Customer to have the Customer purchase a Product that was created using the Product class.

    • Method Detail

      • getID

        long getID()
        Get the Customer unique ID.
        Returns:
        long value indicating the Customer unique ID.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Get the Customer Name, which may or may not be unique to every Customer.
        Returns:
        String representing the Customer Name.

      • getBalance

        double getBalance()
        Get the Customer balance.
        Returns:
        double value representing the Customer balance

      • addCredit

        void addCredit(double credit)
        Add credit to the Customer, which is not defined as being any particular currency in this interface.
        Parameters:
        credit - A double value.

      • makePurchase

        void makePurchase(Product product)
           throws PurchaseAmountExceededException,
                  BadPurchaseException
        Use this method on a Customer to have the Customer purchase a Product that was created using the Product class.
        Parameters:
        product - A reference to a Product object
        Throws:
        PurchaseAmountExceededException - - This Exception is thrown if the cost of the Product exceeds the Customer balance.
        BadPurchaseException - - This Exception is thrown if there was a problem with the Product.

      • getPurchasedList

        java.util.List<Product> getPurchasedList()
        Get a reference to the List of Products that were purchased by this Customer.
        Returns:
        List<Product>

      • getPurchasedQuantity

        int getPurchasedQuantity()
        Get the number of Products that were purchased by a Customer.
        Returns:
        int Number of Products purchased by a Customer

      • getTotalPurchasesAmount

        double getTotalPurchasesAmount()
        Get the accumulative amount for all the Products purchased by a Customer.
        Returns:
        double representing the monetary amount

      • getAveragePurchaseAmount

        double getAveragePurchaseAmount()
        Get the statistical average monetary amount for all Product purchases made by this customer.
        Returns:
        double

      • getMetrics

        java.lang.String getMetrics()
        Get a newline separated String that shows all the primary values for the fields associated for a Customer.
        Returns:
        String
